intro: Warpuria clandestina, commonly known as the hidden warpuria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and dense, evergreen foliage. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species in botanical research.
